title.rendered: What is behind the popular online game?  – LOOK AT!

content.rendered:
Roblox Security Settings

It is often not easy for parents to control how Roblox is used: users have the option of providing their parents’ email address, but this is not mandatory. Regardless of whether the child is under or over 13 years old, they can play mini-games like Counter Blox – a sort of Roblox version of the well-known shooter game Counter-Strike. There is no separate age rating for the games within “Roblox”.

So-called “account restrictions” can be selected in the account settings. These can be made on the website and are updated on all end devices on which “Roblox” is installed. When restrictions are enabled, only games from a select list that have been approved and curated as youth-friendly by the provider can be played. User-created games in which content unsuitable for children can be found can no longer be played with the restrictions. The use of the “Roblox Studio” remains unaffected. Account restrictions also disable Roblox interactions like private messaging or in-game chats.

If access to all user-generated games is not to be restricted, settings can be made manually: “Roblox” has a useful feature called “Age Visibility” that can be used to set age-appropriate settings for children. The online game also has a central dashboard to restrict chat functions, for example.

Parents can choose a PIN in the Roblox account settings, which is always necessary to change a setting, so that the account restrictions cannot be overridden by the children themselves. Parents can find detailed instructions on account restrictions here.

Some settings can also be made in the games on “Roblox” itself and then only relate specifically to the respective game. In some games, the visibility of blood or killed avatars can be switched off.
